children: Nomogram for interpreting diagnostic test results. In this nomogram, a straight line drawn from a patient's pretest probability of disease (which is estimated from experience, local data, or published literature) through the likelihood ratio for the test result will indicate the posttest probability of disease.

footnotes: Reproduced with permission from Fagan TJ. Letter: nomogram for Bayes theorem. N Engl J Med. 1975;293:257.
